job_title: Anonymous Employee in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: The Grand Rapids community is proud of this little college and supports it well. Good values based education for a good value, you get to contribute to something worthwhile. Beautiful campus. Longevity of faculty and staff, many who are alumni, provides consistency. The amount of their religion in work is appropriate. Enough that you know it is Catholic and feel invited to find out more if you want but you don't feel pressured or have to sign a statement of belief like the other Christian colleges in the area. Nice tuition benefit for employees and their families.
cons: Like many small liberal arts colleges it is struggling. It is not a diverse workforce. Salaries are low. There's a fair amount of dysfunction and outdated systems + policies. The morale is low. There have been cutbacks and lay offs just like every where.

review_title: Great Place to Learn and Explore

job_title: Student Computer Technician in Grand Rapids, MI
pros: Aquinas College offers this great opportunity for currently attending students. All the staff have been friendly and helpful, and my coworkers are great. Working with most faculty is pleasant.
cons: Honestly, aside from the fact that occasionally working with faculty can be difficult, especially when they're obstinate and immature, the only downside of this job is that we don't have a little golfcart. Having one would be really nice when you need to walk all the way across campus to do a job. Other than that, just keep in mind that the help desk positions are only open to student workers.

review_title: Great student opportunity, pays the bills and gains valuable experience while attending college.
job_title: Housekeeping in Grand Rapids, MI
pros:
Opportunity to gain work experience, not to mention pay the rent/bills while going to college. Because you are young, you get a lot of great opportunities, such as supportive supervisors. Honestly, a lot of "big-world" employers aren't so nice or understanding about employees learning how to perform essential tasks or making mistakes. Flexible hours that the employee chooses around available work times or coursework. 
The difficulty of the work is very average. Don't goof around on the job, but it is not back-breaking work. As long as you try your best, and take a deep breath on busy days, you'll do fine.
cons: No paid time off/sick days, no benefits; but this is a student job, not a career.
